page.title: 05A FARMER'S DAY IN FARLEY
page.content: Mr. David Parsons owns and farms Parsonage Farm and also farms Farley Farm with General Fanshawe. Every day, except Thursday, he gets up at quarter to seven. On Thursday he milks the cows at five o'clock and he gets up at half past four. Most days he goes straight out to the dairy-man to check for any problems. The two tractor drivers arrive at eight o'clock and Mr. Parsons gives them orders for the day. Then he goes to breakfast from quarter past eight to quarter past nine. This is usually cereal and toast. He only has a cooked breakfast on Thursday. After breakfast the work varies from day to day depending on the time of year and weather. There are always the cattle to check, paper work to do and machine repairs to do. He has to go to Salisbury for spares and to the market
